gov.nih.nlm.meme.sql
Class MEMESchedule

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nlm.meme.sql.MEMESchedule
All Implemented Interfaces:
Initializable, Runnable
public class MEMESchedule
extends Object
implements Runnable, Initializable

Used to spuport scheduling of MEME tasks. Based on meme_schedule table.

Author:
MEME Group

Field Summary
static String CALENDAR
          Used to indicate that a schedule listener should follow directions given by the schedule instead of overriding the schedule.
static String DELAY
          Used to indicate that a schedule listener should introduce a delay into its cycle.
static String NODELAY
          Used to indicate that a schedule listener should not introduce a delay into its cycle.
static String SHUTDOWN
          Used to indicate that a schedule listener should shut down.
static String STANDBY
          Used to indicate that a schedule listener should stop running and standby for the schedule to report a change in the CPU mode.
 
Constructor Summary
MEMESchedule()
          This constructor is an empty constructor.
 
Method Summary
 void addMEMEScheduleListener(MEMEScheduleListener listener)
          Registers a MEMEScheduleListener in the MEMESchedule
 String getCpuMode(MEMEScheduleListener listener)
          Gets the current cpu mode of an application registered as MEMEScheduleListener in this MEMESchedule, if the run thread is running.
 void initialize(InitializationContext context)
          This implements Initializable.initialize(InitializationContext).
 void removeMEMEScheduleListener(MEMEScheduleListener listener)
          Removes a MEMEScheduleListener from the listener list maintained by the MEMESchedule.
 void run()
          Periodically, it looks up the CPU mode for objects registered as listeners.
 void setDataSource(MEMEDataSource ds)
          Sets the data source used by the schedule.
 void stop()
          Stop the schedule from running

Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(InitializationContext context)
                throws InitializationException
This implements Initializable.initialize(InitializationContext).

Specified by:
initialize in interface Initializable
Parameters:
context - the InitializationContext representation of initialization context.
Throws:
InitializationException - if initialization fails.

setDataSource

public void setDataSource(MEMEDataSource ds)
Sets the data source used by the schedule. This method should be called by the InitializationContext when the initialize method calls context.addHook

Parameters:
ds - the MEMEDataSource.

getCpuMode

public String getCpuMode(MEMEScheduleListener listener)
Gets the current cpu mode of an application registered as MEMEScheduleListener in this MEMESchedule, if the run thread is running. Otherwise it returns the cpu mode of the time the application got registered. Evidently this method should only be used when the thread is running.

Parameters:
listener - the MEMEScheduleListener representation of schedule listener.
Returns:
the String representation of the CPU mode (DELAY,NODELAY,STANDBY,SHUTDOWN).

addMEMEScheduleListener

public void addMEMEScheduleListener(MEMEScheduleListener listener)
                             throws DataSourceException
Registers a MEMEScheduleListener in the MEMESchedule

Parameters:
listener - the MEMEScheduleListener representation of schedule listener.
Throws:
DataSourceException - if failed to add meme schedule listener.

removeMEMEScheduleListener

public void removeMEMEScheduleListener(MEMEScheduleListener listener)
Removes a MEMEScheduleListener from the listener list maintained by the MEMESchedule.

Parameters:
listener - the MEMEScheduleListener representation of schedule listener.

run

public void run()
Periodically, it looks up the CPU mode for objects registered as listeners. If the mode has changed since the last lookup, it informs the application in question.

Specified by:
run in interface Runnable

stop

public void stop()
Stop the schedule from running
